QuestionStatement: Given the production information in the table above, how many workers would be employed if the wage rate were $20.00 per day and if sandwiches sold for $0.50?
Which of the following is true when the production of a good results in negative externalities?
AnswerChoices: The government must produce the good
The private market will produce too little of the good
The private market price will be too low
The government must prevent the production of the good
Private firms will not be able to maximize profit

QuestionStatement: In the long run, a monopolistically competitive firm is allocatively inefficient because the firm will
AnswerChoices: Produce only when marginal cost is greater than marginal revenue
Charge a price greater than the marginal cost
Earn positive economic profits
Earn economic profits
Experience economic losses

QuestionStatement: A change in which of the following will NOT cause a shift in the demand curve for a factor of production?
AnswerChoices: Demand for the goods produced by the factor
Prices of the goods produced by the factor
Prices of substitute factors
Supply of the factor
Supply of substitute factors

QuestionStatement: There are negative externalities associated with the use of a freeway in a major city at rush hour because during this time
AnswerChoices: Drivers slow down other drivers because of the high traffic volume
Drivers value their time more
Government revenues from toll roads increase
Revenues of bus companies increase
Gasoline costs more

QuestionStatement: Economic growth can be depicted using a production possibilities curve by which of the following?
AnswerChoices: A rightward shift of the curve
A movement upward on an existing curve
A movement downward on an existing curve
A movement from a point outside the curve to a point on the curve
A movement from a point on the curve to a point inside the curve

QuestionStatement: If a one-of-a-kind Etruscan vase is offered for sale at an auction, which, if any, of the following correctly shows the supply curve for the vase?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will cause an unregulated monopolist to produce a more allocatively efficient level of output?
AnswerChoices: A tax based on the amount of profits
A tax that does not change as output increases
A tax that increases as output increases
A subsidy that increases as output increases
A subsidy that does not change as output increases

QuestionStatement: The graph above shows the cost and revenue curves for a natural monopoly.  Consider the following two policies for regulating this natural monopolyPolicy I: Require the monopoly to set quantity and price where demand equals marginal costPolicy II: Require the monopoly to set quantity and price where demand equals average total cost
AnswerChoices: Both would result in the same level of output and price
Both would result in an inefficient allocation of resources relative to the unregulated result
Policy I would result in a lower level of output than would Policy II
Policy I would result in a higher price than would Policy II
Policy I might require the payment of a subsidy to the firm

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true in the market for a certain product if producers consistently are willing to sell more at the going price than consumers are willing to buy?
AnswerChoices: Demand is highly inelastic
Supply is highly elastic
The product is inferior
There is a price ceiling on the product
There is a price floor on the product

QuestionStatement: According to the theory of consumer behavior, which of the following decreases first as additional units of a product are consumed?
AnswerChoices: Total utility
Average utility
Marginal utility
Marginal physical product
Total physical product

QuestionStatement: Under which of the following circumstances is a firm experiencing economies of scale?
AnswerChoices: The firm increases only its labor input, and output decreases
The firm doubles its inputs, and output triples
The firm builds a new plant, and the average cost of production increases
The firm hires a new plant manager, and profits increase
The product price increases, and the firm increases its output.

QuestionStatement: Which of the following statements about cost is always true for both monopolies and perfectly competitive firms?
AnswerChoices: Average total cost equals marginal cost when average total cost is a minimum
Marginal cost decreases as production increases
Average fixed cost is equal to marginal cost when average fixed cost is a minimum
Average variable cost is equal to marginal cost when marginal cost is a minimum
Average variable cost decreases as production increases

QuestionStatement: 1.      The graph above depicts cost and revenue curves for a typical firm in a monopolistically competitive industry.  Suppose that the firm is producing 0M units of output.  To maximize profit, it should do which fo the following to output and price?                  Output                  Pricea.      Increase            Decreaseb.      Increase            Increasec.      Decrease            Increased.      Not change                  Increasee.      Not change                  Not change
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: In most cases the supply curve for a perfectly competitive industry can be described as which of the following?
AnswerChoices: More elastic in the short run than in the long run
More elastic in the long run than in the short run
Downward sloping in the short run
Perfectly inelastic in the long run
Perfectly elastic in the short run

QuestionStatement: Compared with firms in a perfectly competitive industry, firms in a monopolistically competitive industry are inefficient because they
AnswerChoices: Make economic profits in the long run
Do not lower the product price if input prices fall
Restrict their output level to maximize profit
Charge the highest price that consumers will pay
Waste resources by producing an excess amount of output

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of monopolistically competitive markets?
AnswerChoices: Relatively easy market entry
Differentiated products
Substantial product advertising
A large number of both buyers and sellers
Long run economic profits

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will happen in the labor market if the price of the good produced by workers decreases?
AnswerChoices: The marginal product of labor will increase
The marginal product of labor will decrease
The marginal revenue product of labor will increase
The marginal revenue product of labor will decrease
The demand curve for labor will shift to the right

QuestionStatement: Assume that a firm is hiring labor in a perfectly competitive labor market.  If the marginal revenue product of labor is greater than the wage rate, which of the following will be true?
AnswerChoices: The firm must be losing money
The firm should employ more workers
The firm should replace workers with capital
The firm is maximizing profits
The firm is experiencing diminishing marginal utility

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of the marginal cost of providing a pure public good to one more consumer?
AnswerChoices: It is positive
It is equal to zero
It is equal to the original cost of the good
It decreases as the number of consumers increases
It increases as the number of consumers increases
